summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 26, 2019, discussing the coordination of victim lists between the New York (NY) and Miami (MM) investigations into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails focus on using the FBI's Victim Notification System (VNS) to manage and cross-check lists of identified victims.

persons.name: Lenny
persons.context: Addressed in an email forwarding a victim list for the Epstein case, indicating involvement in victim notification coordination.

events.title: Coordination of Epstein Victim Lists
events.description: Internal FBI email chain discussing the need to cross-check and potentially import the list of identified victims from the Miami (MM) Epstein investigation into the New York (NY) case's Victim Notification System (VNS).

keyFacts: The FBI was actively managing a list of identified victims in the Epstein case through a Victim Notification System (VNS) as of July 2019.
There was coordination between the New York (NY) and Miami (MM) FBI offices regarding victim lists for the Epstein investigations.
The email indicates an intent to ensure victims in both cases received support from the Victim Services Division (VSD).
The communication is marked with a confidentiality notice, highlighting the sensitive nature of the victim information.
